title: Finding Stephen King at the End of Fear Street
itunes:title: Finding Stephen King at the End of Fear Street
itunes:subtitle: Fear Street is on the mind lately, thanks to Netflix's new trilogy of films this month from director Leigh Janiak (see: Fear Street 1994, 1978, 1666). Because of this, the Losers have teamed up with Kelly Nugent and Lindsay Katai of the Teen Creep...
description:
Fear Street is on the mind lately, thanks to Netflix's new trilogy of films this month from director Leigh Janiak (see: Fear Street 1994, 1978, 1666). Because of this, the Losers have teamed up with Kelly Nugent and Lindsay Katai of the Teen Creeps podcast to chart their respective journeys from Shadyside to King's Dominion -- a journey familiar to many. Beyond King, however, the four discuss their Fear Street origins, their favorite titles, the recurring themes and motifs of the series, and why Stine's work continues to resonate with newer generations today. They also weigh in on Janiak's trilogy and debate whether or not the films capture the spirit and tone of the books. So, a lot to unpack here.


Follow us on Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | Patreon
